column4: Could someone help me in a PM with the following issue: X.Org's config shows that the display on my laptop can do 640x480, 800x600, and manuf. specs back that up. HOWEVER, Gnome doesn't give me 800x600 as an option on the screen resolution changer.
thats where you select what res your monitor can display
use tab to autocomplete nicknames u want to speak to
did you select the right driver and resolutions?
When i click 'System > Screen Resolution' the little applet only gives 640x480 as an option.
log out , alt+ctrl+backspace to restart xserver, log back in , go to video options see if u can select that resolution
EXCELLENT help. Now all i got to do is figure out why sound wont work.
When setting up ubuntu, i noticed many error messages when it was setting up Gstreamer. is that what i'd reconfigure next?
i would assume so , but i havent done it myself , cant really help you with sound ,
Thanks anyways.. my Gnome looked horrible with the LCD stretch effect.
